title: Another 820-2936 Fan spins 2 sec
message:
Hello

This Board has no sign of water damage.
When it's plugged in the fan spins for 1 sec, stops for 3 sec and keeps repeating that process.

PPBUS_G3H is good
PP3V42_G3H is 3.5v

What can be causing this fanspin?

title: Another 820-2936 Fan spins 2 sec
message: meassured at l7550 and there is a short to ground

title: Another 820-2936 Fan spins 2 sec
message: 3,4,6,7,8 on q7550 shorted

title: Another 820-2936 Fan spins 2 sec
message:
I bet L7550 is just the normal low resistance of about 2-3 Ohm.

Is voltage also coming high on L7510 when fan spins?

title: Another 820-2936 Fan spins 2 sec
message:
L7550 is about 0,1 ohm
voltage is 0 all the time at both L7510 and L7550

title: Another 820-2936 Fan spins 2 sec
message:
Check R7402, especially pin 2 for corrosion and measure 90K.
Did you measure over L7550 or L7550 to GND?

title: Another 820-2936 Fan spins 2 sec
message:
measured over.
diode mode L7510 and L7550 is 0.015 on both
R7402 is ok but pin 2 on u7400 does look a bit worse than the other pins.

title: Another 820-2936 Fan spins 2 sec
message:
Why would you measure over a coil? Resistance to GND is the one that matters.
Measure R7402 by measuring from F7040 to pin 2 on U7400, this way you ensure that there are no corroded traces.

title: Another 820-2936 Fan spins 2 sec
message: it measures 91k

title: Another 820-2936 Fan spins 2 sec
message:
So what is resistance to GND on L7550 and L7510?
Does all_sys_pwrgd come high when the fan spins?

title: Another 820-2936 Fan spins 2 sec
message:
all_sys_pwrgd goes from 0v to about 3v when fan spins
resistans to ground on both coils is 0.015

title: Another 820-2936 Fan spins 2 sec
message: 0.015 in Ohm or diode mode? 0.015 is way too low, compare it with another board. Boards I have here measure between 5-13 Ohm.

title: Another 820-2936 Fan spins 2 sec
message: yes, it's to low. I wrote that in my second and third post in this thread. Or is it not a short to ground when it measures that low?

title: Another 820-2936 Fan spins 2 sec
message: 0.015 Ohm to GND is too low. Nothing more I can say. Compare it to some working boards, but the ones I have here are 5 Ohm minimum. It would most likely be a shorted CPU as it is on 2 different busses.

title: Another 820-2936 Fan spins 2 sec
message:
hi
I think I have problems with understanding how to measure things.
I measured L7550 and L7510 in diode mode, red on ground black on coil, and got 0.013
If i measure ohm on my fluke between coil and ground i get 10.9 on L7550 and L7510

My other board, with no image; measures 10.7 on L7550 and 9.6 on L7510

Sorry if i'm stupid but i'm trying to learn this!!!

title: Another 820-2936 Fan spins 2 sec
message: OK, voltage on both pins of Y2805 when fans spins?

title: Another 820-2936 Fan spins 2 sec
message:
it's a bit hard to see but 0,9 volt on both pins.
the "no image" board is 0.97 volt

title: Another 820-2936 Fan spins 2 sec
message: That is all ok. Running our of ideas here too. You say R7402 does look corroded, are you able to take a picture? I'm pretty sure it will be corrosion somewhere. Any history on this board?

title: Another 820-2936 Fan spins 2 sec
message:
I bought the mbp for 50$ with no other information from The seller than that it wouldn't start. 
R7402 doesn't look corroded. It's the pin on U7400 that it's attached to that was corroded.

title: Another 820-2936 Fan spins 2 sec
message:
Well I would think it has been a liquid spill then. Look closer for corrosion.
Also what voltage are you getting on both sides of R7402?

title: Another 820-2936 Fan spins 2 sec
message:
I get 12.6 volt on both sides. It was only that pin on u7400 that looked bad. But almost all joints around u7400 look a bit poorly soldered. There are many pads that doesn,t hav solder up on the side on the chip. 

Can the problem be caused by a bad u7400. Should i try to replace it?

title: Another 820-2936 Fan spins 2 sec
message:
It could, but I have never seen U7400 fail. Lets say 5% chance......
I would suspect something wring with SPI ROM first. Measure all pins of it on diode mode and compare to working board.

title: Another 820-2936 Fan spins 2 sec
message: same numbers on SPI ROM on both boards.

title: Another 820-2936 Fan spins 2 sec
message: all S0 and S3 rails goes high when fan spin

title: Another 820-2936 Fan spins 2 sec
message: I am out of ideas on this one. Most likely corrosion somewhere. If you can take HiRes close up pictures of the board I can have a look..

title: Another 820-2936 Fan spins 2 sec
message:
I Would try replace the SPI with one from a donor 820-2936 board. You dont need to worry about ME region on 2011 years so you can just pull the EFI of a donor board with no reprogramming.

You also need to inspect u2800. U2800 drives the clock signal for the PCH and therefore is important when looking at quarter fan spin.

Check R7051 and R7052 and all corresponding traces. This is current sensing for the battery and can sometimes cause quarter fan spin symtoms. After doing all of the above you are looking at a failed PCH.

title: Another 820-2936 Fan spins 2 sec
message: You most definitely need to worry about the ME! For testing it does not matter but it does cause issues.
